data.title: Your custom livery for the new/returning cars
data.meta_description: Which types of liveries do you want to make for the new/returning cars in GT7? I'm interested to hear what you guys have in mind that I haven't thought of...
data.text:
RetroJohan

A.K.A GT_johan

2,083

Sweden

RetroJohan

Sep 19, 2021

#1

Which types of liveries do you want to make for the new/returning cars in GT7? I'm interested to hear what you guys have in mind that I haven't thought of

List of the new/returning cars.

Alfa Romeo 155 2.5 V6 TI 1993

Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B Lungo Berlinetta 1937

Alpine A220 1968

Aston Martin DB5 1964

Audi R8 LMS Evo 2019

BAC Mono 2011

BMW 3.0 CSL 1971

Chevrolet Corvette C4 1996

De Tomaso Mangusta 1969

Ferrari FXX K 2014

Ford GPW 1944

Ford GT LM GTE 2018

Ford Mustang Shelby GT350R 2020

Genesis G70 GR4

Genesis X GR3

Genesis Vision Gran Turismo

Lamborghini "Lambo V12" Vision GT 2019

Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 2009

Mazda RX-Vision Concept 2016

Mercedes 300SL W194 1952

Mercedes CLK LM 1998

Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution V GSR 1998

Nissan 370Z 2008

Nissan Skyline KPGC10 GT-R 1971

Nissan Skyline R34 GT-R GT500 1999

Nissan Silvia S13 Qs 1988

Nissan Silvia S15 Spec R Aero 2002

Porsche 356 A/1500 GS Carrera 1956

Porsche Spyder Type 550/1500 RS 1955

Porsche 911 996 GT1 Strassenversion 1997

Porsche 917K 1970

Porsche 917 Living Legend 2013

Porsche Carrera GT 2003

Porsche Vision Gran Turismo

Toyota Aqua S 2011

Toyota Supra GT500 1997

Volkswagen 1200 1966

Polo GTI 2014

Volkswagen Scirocco R 2010

I would like to try to recreate the Porsche 911 GT1 "Mobil" Livery on the 911 GT1 straßenversion of course.

Last edited: Oct 23, 2021

4,683

Connecticut

Ridley-X4

Sep 19, 2021

#2

I'm definitely not good at graphic design, but I think I'll mostly make liveries for cars that can have interesting customization options, such as certain bodykits, rear wings, etc. Otherwise, I'll mostly stick to making a basic livery that uses both the official sponsors/partners of the FIAGTCs like Puma, BBS, and Michelin, but also part manufacturers used on the actual car, whether it's stuff I install via GT Auto like the Brembo brakes, or parts that are already installed even as-stock, like how some hypercars have seatbelts by Schroth or Sabelt. Heck, I might even include the fictional brands that may connect to my car, too, like Auto Plus or Brighton Antiques.

Last edited: Sep 19, 2021

735

Maryland, USA

Sep 19, 2021

#3

100% gonna make a 1999 Calsonic GT-R livery on top of the 1999 Pennzoil GT-R.

Already made an exact replica of the 2008 Raybrig NSX in GT Sport, probably the most fun I've had making a livery.

Last edited: Sep 19, 2021

I'm already predicting that Living Legend will be the car I'll work the most, but I would start with a classic livery like this:

#5

I do certain takes on replicas. Doing BTCC Super Touring liveries, on the GR.4 Atenza. Seeing the GR.4 G70, if it's FR(hope it's not 4WD), I'll make another replica of my avatar. I've done a couple for the Crown Athlete in GT Sport, but really want the latest car.

I'll have to see what the GR.4 car list looks like. If we get updated GT4 cars, I'll probably replicate the GT4 European Series liveries.

4,929

United States

Stawookie

Sep 20, 2021

#6

1938 Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B:

The same car (Chassis #412035) PD modeled for GT7 won the very first Watkins Glen Grand Prix in 1948.

Another 8C Lungo Berlinetta won the Mille Miglia in 1947.

1944/45 Ford GPW/Willys MB

Some Jeeps in the USAAF were painted in a bright yellow livery and were used as “Follow Me” vehicles to guide outbound aircraft to the correct departure point.

1952 Mercedes-Benz 300SL W194:

The W194 that won the 1952 Carrera La Panamericana.

1956 Porsche 356A GS Carrera:

The 1951 Porsche 356 SL that won the 1100cc class in Le Mans.

1971 Nissan Skyline 2000 GT-R

The GT-R that won the 1971 Japanese Grand Prix at Fuji Speedway.

Last edited: Sep 20, 2021

Stephan

That's what I want to do to the 917LL. The Gulf livery is gonna look sooooo good on that thing! Kudos to anyone who does the Martini and Rothmans liveries for it too.

#9

Which types of liveries do you want to make for the new/returning cars in GT7? I'm interested to hear what you guys have in mind that I haven't thought of

I would like to try to recreate the Porsche 911 GT1 "Mobil" Livery on the 911 GT1 straßenversion of course.

View attachment 1081611

I would probably make mostly unique and custom liveries, but the addition of changible body kits and other things is really exciting.

#10

I've never created a livery before, but I will try to create this exact livery for the CLK-LM

And a second one based off the 1997 FIA test cars:

Sep 21, 2021

#11

I have updated the first post with a list of the new/returning cars that we know so far.

6,249

Ottawa

Pyano1132

Sep 22, 2021

#12

Personally I'd like to give the new Porsche Carrera GT the full-on GT1 tune treatment since we now have rollcages, widebodies and wings back in the game.

I'd like to base the livery off the one-off Carrera GTR by GPR Racing. Maybe not an exact 1:1 replica since it's pretty plain but certainly utilizing a similar kind of stripe and the same black/red over silver colour pallet. Get some sponsors on there an all that too.

Then I'd also like to get the 2017 911 RSR factory livery on both the 917 Living Legend and the 911 GT1. The black, red and white one with the Porsche Intelligent Performance badges in the grey stripe. I love that livery so much and put it on the 962 in Sport.

Also on the Genesis Vision GT car in Group 3 I'd also like to put a Hyundai "N" factory livery on it like this I30N here. Absolutely love the Hyundai factory colours too.

Last edited: Sep 22, 2021

5,343

Druids Bend

I'm hoping they make vintage-style tyre stickers, so we don't have to put ultra modern Michelin tyres on a Group C car... I'll be making many retro liveries on the returning classics.

#25

Can't wait to replicate a bunch of 80's 'Corvette Challenge' liveries using the newly confirmed C4. If what Kazunori says is true about having rollcage upgrades too, then that will only help sell the look.

The Corvette Challenge - C4 Corvette Racing Series - Vette Magazine

In the 1980's Chevrolet Corvette dominance of SCCA Showroom Stock racing competition spawned a marque-specific race series for C4 Corvettes called the Corvette Challenge - Vette Magazine

Sounds like a really good open-lobby race idea too.

Last edited: Oct 22, 2021

Sounds like a really good open-lobby race idea too.

I don't think there's any way in heck you're going to get that many people rocking C4's with a roll-cage and a racing livery in an open lobby. Might be worth starting a casual league or something in the online racing section of the forum. That would really help the idea along even more.
